item7: Management’s Discussion Analysis Financial Condition Results Operations 2024 Executive Overview strong year, setting records achieving milestones, including: Full year revenues hit all-time high $25 billion, over 15 percent higher than prior year Seven consecutive quarters record revenues Record full year operating income $3.6 billion, over 80 percent higher than prior year All-time high cash operations almost $6 billion Higher ticket prices 2024 versus 2023 all major cruise lines onboard spending levels accelerated sequentially each quarter throughout year Record booking trends record year-end customer deposits, indicating continuation strong momentum we’ve been experiencing last two years remain laser focused further reducing interest expense rebuilding investment-grade balance sheet. During 2024, made debt prepayments over $3 billion, bringing total prepayments over $7 billion since beginning 2023. Additionally, reduced debt balance over $8 billion peak January 2023, ending year $27.5 billion debt. delivering long-term value shareholders through improved operational execution across cruise lines.
item2: passenger ticket revenues seasonal. Demand cruises been greatest during third quarter, which includes Northern Hemisphere summer months. higher demand during third quarter results higher ticket prices occupancy levels and, accordingly, largest share operating income typically earned during period. results also impacted ships being taken out-of-service planned maintenance, which schedule during non-peak seasons.
